keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: CIVIL WAR (THE WAR BETWEEN THE STATES)

docs.snippet: The volunteer service now numbers four hundred and eighty thousand men, leaving but twenty thousand more enlistments to reach the number authorized by Congress.

headline.main: THE GREAT REBELLION.; Late Intelligence from Port Royal and Beaufort. The Town Probably Occupied on Thursday. The Rebels Preparing to Make a Stand. REPORTED SKIRMISHING OF PICKETS. IMPORTANT NEWS FROM MISSOURI. Retrograde Movements of the National Forces. Gen. Hunter's Army en route for St. Louis. The Rebels in Kentucky Panic Stricken. Retreat of Zollicoffer's Army to Cumberland Gap. Another Brilliant Skirmish on the Upper Potomac. SPECIAL DISPATCH FROM WASHINGTON. STRENGTH OF THE VOLUNTEER SERVICE. THE WAREHOUSING SYSTEM. FROM THE UPPER POTOMAC. AFFAIRS ON THE LOWER POTOMAC. A VISIT TO THE STEAMER PENSACOLA. TRADE AT BEAUFORT. WANT TO BE COLLECTOR AT BEAUFORT. DISTINGUISHED PERSONS IN THE CITY. SHELLS ORDERED. VACANCIES IN THE NAVAL ACADEMY. PROPOSALS FOR BEEF CATTLE. THE CASE OF EX-SENATOR GWIN, ETC. PLACED ON THE RETIRED LIST. THE BRIGADE OF LOYAL VIRGINIANS. ARMY BLANKETS GEN. KEYES IN COMMAND. A FIGHTING QUAKER. PROMOTED. HARLAND'S LIGHT CAVALRY. NOT MADE REGULARS. BROADHEAD'S CAVALRY. A SALUTE FROM BRITISH GUNS. CONSULS APPO

docs.lead_paragraph: The volunteer service now numbers four hundred and eighty thousand men, leaving but twenty thousand more enlistments to reach the number authorized by Congress.

docs.snippet: The steamship Champion arrived at this port yesterday, from Aspinwall on the 6th inst., with the mails, passengers and treasure from California. The amount of her tresure is $875,730. Among her passengers is Gen. HERRAN, Minister from New-Granada to...
docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Champion arrived at this port yesterday, from Aspinwall on the 6th inst., with the mails, passengers and treasure from California. The amount of her tresure is $875,730. Among her passengers is Gen. HERRAN, Minister from New-Granada to the United States, accompanied by his family.

headline.main: Hotel Proprietors Union Club.; REBELLION TO BE SUPPRESSED THE LOWER WARDS TO BE PROTECTED.

IMPORTANT FROM THE LOWER POTOMAC; THE FIFTH EXCELSIOR ON MATTHIAS POINT. Highly Important and Successful Reconnoissance by Col. Graham's Regiment. A Masked Battery Discovered--Complete Surprise of the Rebel Pickels--Important Prisoner Taken--Rebel Property Destroyed--A New Battery opposite Maryland Point--Contrabands, & c.

FROM CHARLESTON THROUGH BEAUFORT.; OUR PRIVATEERSMEN. GEN. BEAUREGARD AT HOUR WITH HIS SUPERIORS. SOUTH CAROLINA AND HER INVADERS. THE BATTLE OF LEESBURGH. FOREIGN MAILS FROM THE SOUTH. POST-OFFICE NOTICE. WHAT THEY ARE ABOUT IN CHARLESTON. KENTUCKY. MOVEMENTS AT THE STATE CAPITAL.
ARCTIC EXPLORATIONS.; Lecture of Dr. J.S. Hayes before the New-York Geographical and Statistical Society. DR. HAYES' REPORT.
